sections.heading: 1. PURPOSE
sections.text: This policy sets out [COMPANY_NAME]'s approach to retaining and deleting personal data in compliance with UK GDPR storage limitation principles (Article 5(1)(e)).

sections.heading: 2. SCOPE
sections.text: This policy applies to all personal data processed by [COMPANY_NAME], whether in electronic or hard copy format.

sections.heading: 3. PRINCIPLES
sections.text:
Personal data shall be:
- Kept for no longer than necessary for the purposes for which it is processed
- Reviewed regularly and deleted when no longer required
- Retained to comply with legal, regulatory, or contractual obligations
- Retained to establish, exercise, or defend legal claims

sections.heading: 4. RETENTION SCHEDULE
sections.text:
**4.1 Employee Data**

| Data Category | Retention Period | Reason | Deletion Method |
|---------------|------------------|--------|------------------|
| Recruitment records (unsuccessful) | 6 months | Discrimination claims (6 months) | Secure deletion |
| Personnel files | 6 years from termination | Contract and statutory claims | Secure deletion |
| Payroll and tax records | 6 years from tax year end | HMRC requirements | Secure deletion |
| Pension records | Permanent (or until scheme closure) | Pensions Act 1995 | Transfer to scheme |
| Accident records | 3 years (12 years for serious injury) | Limitation Act 1980 | Secure deletion |
| Disciplinary/grievance | 6 years from conclusion | Employment tribunal claims | Secure deletion |
| Sickness records | 3 years from end of employment | SSP Regulations | Secure deletion |
| Working time records | 2 years | Working Time Regulations | Secure deletion |

**4.2 Customer/Client Data**

| Data Category | Retention Period | Reason | Deletion Method |
|---------------|------------------|--------|------------------|
| Customer accounts (active) | Duration of relationship + 6 years | Contract claims (6 years) | Secure deletion |
| Customer accounts (inactive) | 6 years from last transaction | Contract and tax | Secure deletion |
| Sales/purchase records | 6 years from end of tax year | Tax law | Secure deletion |
| Contracts | 6 years from expiry | Limitation Act 1980 | Secure deletion |
| Credit card data | Immediately after authorization (unless legitimate reason) | PCI DSS | Secure overwrite |
| Customer communications | [DEFINE - e.g., 3 years] | [Business need] | Secure deletion |
| Marketing consent | Until withdrawn or 2 years inactive | PECR | Deletion |

**4.3 Financial Records**

| Data Category | Retention Period | Reason | Deletion Method |
|---------------|------------------|--------|------------------|
| Accounts and tax records | 6 years from end of tax year | Corporation Tax Act 2010 | Secure deletion |
| VAT records | 6 years | VATA 1994 | Secure deletion |
| Invoices and receipts | 6 years | Tax law | Secure deletion |
| Bank statements | 6 years | Tax and audit | Secure deletion |
| Payroll records | 6 years | Tax law | Secure deletion |

**4.4 Website/Marketing Data**

| Data Category | Retention Period | Reason | Deletion Method |
|---------------|------------------|--------|------------------|
| Analytics data | [DEFINE - e.g., 26 months] | Business insights | Anonymization |
| Cookie data | [DEFINE - per cookie policy] | Functionality/analytics | Auto-expiry |
| Email marketing lists | Until consent withdrawn or 2 years inactive | Consent validity | Deletion |
| Website forms | [DEFINE - e.g., 90 days unless converted] | Processing purpose | Deletion |

**4.5 CCTV Footage**

| Data Category | Retention Period | Reason | Deletion Method |
|---------------|------------------|--------|------------------|
| CCTV footage | 30 days (unless incident) | Security purposes | Auto-overwrite |
| Incident footage | Until incident resolved + 6 months | Legal claims | Deletion |

**4.6 Special Category Data**

| Data Category | Retention Period | Reason | Deletion Method |
|---------------|------------------|--------|------------------|
| Health data (OH referrals) | 6 years from termination | Legal claims | Secure destruction |
| DBS checks | 6 months (record of check kept) | Recruitment | Secure destruction |
| Diversity monitoring | Anonymized after 6 months | Equality monitoring | Anonymization |

**4.7 Litigation/Legal Claims**

| Data Category | Retention Period | Reason | Deletion Method |
|---------------|------------------|--------|------------------|
| Litigation files | Until claim resolved + 6 years | Limitation Act | Secure deletion |
| Subject access requests | 6 years | Potential claims | Secure deletion |

sections.heading: 5. LEGAL HOLDS
sections.text:
If data is subject to a legal hold (e.g., litigation, investigation, or regulatory requirement), it must be retained beyond normal retention periods until the hold is lifted.

Legal holds are managed by [LEGAL_DEPARTMENT/DPO].

sections.heading: 6. ARCHIVING
sections.text:
Where data must be retained beyond active use:
- Archive in secure, access-controlled systems
- Clearly label with retention expiry date
- Restrict access to authorized personnel only
- Review archived data annually

sections.heading: 7. DELETION PROCEDURES
sections.text:
**7.1 Electronic Data**
- Secure deletion using approved software (e.g., multiple overwrites)
- Destruction of storage media when decommissioned
- Deletion logs maintained

**7.2 Physical Records**
- Shredding using cross-cut shredders or confidential waste service
- Destruction certificates obtained for bulk destruction
- Witnessed destruction for highly sensitive data

**7.3 Backup Data**
- Deletion from backups within [PERIOD - e.g., 90 days]
- Backup retention policy: [DETAILS]

sections.heading: 8. ANONYMIZATION
sections.text:
Where data is anonymized (truly irreversibly), it is no longer personal data and retention limits do not apply.

Anonymization must be:
- Irreversible (cannot be re-identified)
- Documented and tested
- Approved by DPO

sections.heading: 9. REVIEW AND MONITORING
sections.text:
- Annual review of retention schedule
- Quarterly deletion sweeps for expired data
- Audit trail of deletions maintained
- Responsible persons: [ROLES]

sections.heading: 10. SUBJECT ACCESS REQUESTS
sections.text: If a subject access request is received, data must be retained (even if deletion due) until the request is fulfilled.

sections.heading: 11. RESPONSIBILITIES
sections.text:
- **Data Protection Officer:** Maintain and review this policy
- **IT Department:** Implement technical deletion procedures
- **Department Heads:** Ensure compliance within their teams
- **All Staff:** Follow retention requirements and report expired data

sections.heading: 12. TRAINING
sections.text: All staff handling personal data must receive training on this policy.

sections.heading: 13. POLICY REVIEW
sections.text:
This policy will be reviewed annually or when:
- Legal/regulatory requirements change
- Business processes change
- Data protection incidents occur
